filmography.title: East of Eden
filmography.role_description: A wayward, angst-ridden young man in 1917 California who vies for the affection of his deeply religious father against his favored brother.
filmography.plot: A wilful young man contends against his brother for the attention of their religious father while reconnecting with his estranged mother and falling for his brother's girlfriend.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor (First Posthumous Nomination in History)

filmography.title: Rebel Without a Cause
filmography.role_description: A rebellious teenager new to town who clashes with his parents and local bullies, becoming the definitive icon of teenage disillusionment.
filmography.plot: A rebellious young man with a troubled past comes to a new town, finding friends and enemies.

filmography.title: Giant
filmography.role_description: A poor, ambitious ranch hand who strikes oil and becomes a wealthy but dissolute tycoon, clashing with a family of cattle barons.
filmography.plot: Sprawling epic covering the life of a Texas cattle rancher and his family and their rivalry with cowboy and oil tycoon Jett Rink.

filmography.title: Fixed Bayonets!
filmography.role_description: A minor, uncredited role as a GI who guards the rear during the Korean War; Dean's first feature film appearance.
filmography.plot: During the Korean War, a platoon is left behind to guard a mountain pass and cover the retreat of their division.

filmography.title: Sailor Beware
filmography.role_description: A brief, uncredited appearance as a boxing cornerman in this Martin and Lewis comedy.
filmography.plot: A sailor with an allergy to cosmetics gets drafted and must avoid women while dealing with a bumbling friend.

filmography.title: Has Anybody Seen My Gal?
filmography.role_description: A small, uncredited role as a soda fountain employee who serves a complicated sundae to Charles Coburn.
filmography.plot: A rich man intends to leave his fortune to the family of a woman who rejected him, but decides to test them first.

filmography.title: Trouble Along the Way
filmography.role_description: An uncredited extra role as a fan in the stands in this John Wayne sports comedy.
filmography.plot: A college facing closure hires a disgraced football coach to build a winning team and save the school.

filmography.title: Hill Number One: A Story of Faith and Inspiration
filmography.role_description: An early television movie role where he portrays the disciple John, earning him a fan following among Catholic schoolgirls.
filmography.plot: A television dramatization of the events surrounding the crucifixion and resurrection of Jesus Christ.

filmography.title: The Dark, Dark Hours (General Electric Theater)
filmography.role_description: A gun-wielding hoodlum who holds a doctor and his family hostage; starred alongside Ronald Reagan.
filmography.plot: A doctor's home is invaded by a young criminal, leading to a tense standoff and psychological battle.

filmography.title: A Long Time Till Dawn (Kraft Television Theatre)
filmography.role_description: A troubled young man recently released from prison who struggles to reintegrate into society and his father's expectations.
filmography.plot: A poetic and gritty drama about a youth trying to find his way after incarceration.

filmography.title: The Unlighted Road (Schlitz Playhouse)
filmography.role_description: A Korean War veteran who unwittingly gets involved with a hijacking ring and believes he has committed a crime.
filmography.plot: A young drifter takes a job at a roadside diner and falls into a trap set by local criminals.
filmography.awards: One of his final TV Roles

filmography.title: I'm a Fool (General Electric Theater)
filmography.role_description: A poor racetrack swipe who lies about his wealth to impress a girl, based on the Sherwood Anderson story.
filmography.plot: A young man ruins his chance at love by pretending to be wealthy and upper-class to impress a woman.

filmography.title: Sentence of Death (Studio One)
filmography.role_description: A man wrongly convicted of murder who awaits execution while a shopkeeper struggles with his conscience.
filmography.plot: A drama about a store owner who identifies the wrong man in a lineup, sending an innocent youth to death row.

filmography.title: Glory in the Flower (Omnibus)
filmography.role_description: A disaffected youth in a drama that foreshadows his role in Rebel Without a Cause.
filmography.plot: A story about small-town life and the tensions between generations.

filmography.title: The Evil Within (Tales of Tomorrow)
filmography.role_description: A scientist's assistant who accidentally unleashes a chemical that brings out the evil nature in people.
filmography.plot: A sci-fi horror episode where a serum transforms a woman into a malevolent force.

filmography.title: The Capture of Jesse James (You Are There)
filmography.role_description: The historical figure who infamously assassinated the outlaw Jesse James.
filmography.plot: A historical reenactment of the events leading up to the death of Jesse James.

filmography.title: No Room (Danger)
filmography.role_description: A steward dealing with a tense situation involving a polio patient on a flight.
filmography.plot: A suspense drama set on an airplane involving a medical emergency.

filmography.title: Death Is My Neighbor (Danger)
filmography.role_description: A mysterious janitor involved in a suspenseful plot in a boarding house.
filmography.plot: A psychological thriller about paranoia and murder in a close-knit setting.

filmography.title: The Little Woman (Danger)
filmography.role_description: A menacing figure who threatens a woman in this suspense anthology episode.
filmography.plot: A tense drama focusing on a woman facing a dangerous situation in her home.

filmography.title: Ten Thousand Horses Singing (Studio One)
filmography.role_description: A small role in a larger drama, typical of his early paying gigs in New York television.
filmography.plot: A drama about wealth and ambition starring John Forsythe.

filmography.title: Abraham Lincoln (Studio One)
filmography.role_description: A soldier pardoned by Lincoln in this historical drama.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the presidency of Abraham Lincoln during the Civil War.

filmography.title: A Word from a Sealed Jar (Studio One)
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in a drama about wartime correspondence.
filmography.plot: A story revolving around letters and memories from the war front.

filmography.title: Keep Our Honor Bright (Kraft Television Theatre)
filmography.role_description: A college student facing an ethical dilemma involving cheating and academic pressure.
filmography.plot: A university-set drama exploring the pressures of honor and success among students.

filmography.title: Something for an Empty Briefcase (Campbell Summer Soundstage)
filmography.role_description: A criminal on the run who encounters a variety of characters while trying to hide.
filmography.plot: A suspenseful drama about a thief trying to evade capture.

filmography.title: Harvest (Robert Montgomery Presents)
filmography.role_description: A young man in a rural setting dealing with family expectations and harvest time.
filmography.plot: A Thanksgiving-themed drama about a farm family.
